snippet: The United States government started its new budget year with a deficit in October, although the imbalance was made worse by a calendar quirk.
abstract: Treasury Department says October federal deficit was $136.5 billion, up 12.2  percent from October 2014; deficit for 2015 budget year was $438.9 billion, lowest in eight years; fact that November benefit checks were mailed in October caused some of the shortfall.
lead_paragraph: The United States government started its new budget year with a deficit in October, although the imbalance was made worse by a calendar quirk.

headline.print_headline: Calendar Quirk Exacerbates Government Deficit Figure
headline.main: Calendar Quirk Exacerbates Government Deficit Figure
